intro: Goodenia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf goodenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
